titles.title: Give to the Winds Thy Fears

comments.comment: This hymnal has not been proofed - data may be incomplete or incorrect

verse.name: v1
v2
verse.lines: Through waves and clouds and storms, He gently clears the way; wait thou His time, so shall this night soon end in joyous day.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Still heavy is thy heart, still sink thy spirits down? Cast off the weight, let fear depart, and ev'ry care be gone.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: What though thou rules not, yet heav'n, and earth, and hell proclaim, God sitteth on the throne, and ruleth all things well.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Leave to His sov'reign sway to choose and to command. so shalt thou wond'ring own His way, how wise, how strong His hand!

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: Far, far above thy thought His counsel shall appear, when fully He the work hath wrought, that caused thy needless fear.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: Thou seest our weakness, Lord, our hearts are known to Thee; O lift Thou up the sinking heart, confirm the feeble knee.

verse.name: v8
verse.lines: Let us in life, in death, Thy steadfast truth declare, and publish with our latest breath Thy love and guardian care.
